content.description: Lake side face of boulder. Small handholds and footholds go up center of lake side face. Moss/debris in it recently not well cleaned. Follow the obvious pockets up and over. Variation of climb exists to right of route but personally have not climbed it. Can be wet and slick.
content.protection: Falls are directly to rock on bad slope. Bring a pad if you don't want a broken butt.
content.location: Lake side face of Boulder. Flat start standing on rock.

content.description: Super easy up but good for working on small holds.
content.protection: If you fall the only thing you hurt is pride.
content.location: On shore side of boulder. Small ledge marks start. Handholds are obvious with a three finger jam to the right of start. A shallow pocket and a large knob on top to pull through. Rest of top out is super easy. Route is almost doable in three or four moves. Can be made more fun by adding in extra moves as there are plenty of holds here to the left and right.

content.description: Lakeside Boulder with several solid routes up. Locals occasionally block a V-easy route with a large log.
